verses.name: Psalms 106:1
verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 106:2
verses.text: Who can utter the mighty acts of the Lord? who can shew forth all his praise?

verses.name: Psalms 106:3
verses.text: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

verses.name: Psalms 106:4
verses.text: Remember me, O Lord, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

verses.name: Psalms 106:5
verses.text: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 106:6
verses.text: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

verses.name: Psalms 106:7
verses.text: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.

verses.name: Psalms 106:8
verses.text: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

verses.name: Psalms 106:9
verses.text: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

verses.name: Psalms 106:10
verses.text: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

verses.name: Psalms 106:11
verses.text: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

verses.name: Psalms 106:12
verses.text: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

verses.name: Psalms 106:13
verses.text: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

verses.name: Psalms 106:14
verses.text: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

verses.name: Psalms 106:15
verses.text: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

verses.name: Psalms 106:16
verses.text: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 106:17
verses.text: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

verses.name: Psalms 106:18
verses.text: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 106:19
verses.text: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

verses.name: Psalms 106:20
verses.text: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

verses.name: Psalms 106:21
verses.text: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

verses.name: Psalms 106:22
verses.text: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.

verses.name: Psalms 106:23
verses.text: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:24
verses.text: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

verses.name: Psalms 106:25
verses.text: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 106:26
verses.text: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

verses.name: Psalms 106:27
verses.text: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

verses.name: Psalms 106:28
verses.text: They joined themselves also unto Baal–peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

verses.name: Psalms 106:29
verses.text: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:30
verses.text: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.

verses.name: Psalms 106:31
verses.text: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 106:32
verses.text: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

verses.name: Psalms 106:33
verses.text: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

verses.name: Psalms 106:34
verses.text: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the Lord commanded them:

verses.name: Psalms 106:35
verses.text: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

verses.name: Psalms 106:36
verses.text: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:37
verses.text: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

verses.name: Psalms 106:38
verses.text: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

verses.name: Psalms 106:39
verses.text: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

verses.name: Psalms 106:40
verses.text: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 106:41
verses.text: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:42
verses.text: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

verses.name: Psalms 106:43
verses.text: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

verses.name: Psalms 106:44
verses.text: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

verses.name: Psalms 106:45
verses.text: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

verses.name: Psalms 106:46
verses.text: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

verses.name: Psalms 106:47
verses.text: Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

verses.name: Psalms 106:48
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the Lord.
